page.title: 01The Cerne Valley
page.content: The area is dominated by the Cerne valley and the A352 road which runs its length. The inhabitants of the valley are served by the River Cerne which runs south and provides good drainage for the surrounding chalk hills formuch of the year. The valley boasts fertile grazing land for both sheep and cattle whilst the hills offer an excellent substrate for the production of wheat and barley. Most of the farms are small and privately owned by families who have lived in the area for years. The village of Godmanstone has grown in recent years with the demand for property way from the residential areas such as Dorchester. The hamlet of Nether Cerne, however, remains as it has for many a generation. There are few local amenities other than two churches and a public house ((the smallest in
